title: Is it my fault?

replies.body: I play support as well, and when the adc pings me more than 3 times for no reason i reply with one ping on his face. If that happens again I just go roam and leave him 2v1 on bot for 1 min.

> [{quoted}](name=AlQaeda Taliban,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=X62A55XE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-09-03T11:38:32.706+0000)
>
> I play support as well, and when the adc pings me more than 3 times for no reason i reply with one ping on his face. If that happens again I just go roam and leave him 2v1 on bot for 1 min.

this is a super stupid mentality that just makes people lose more games, putting a personal vendetta ahead of a common goal which is to beat the enemy. Why wouldn't you just mute their pings instead and try to actually be helpful?
Besides it's very anoying when the adc plays too scared.

Depends. As far as playing the fight i cant say as i didn't see the fight itself, but looks like you're both wrong.

As far as toxic behavior. i'd say you prob started it...Yea the support made a mistake, everyone makes them and after the support said don't ping him it's obvious he's salty and anything further would turn into an argument or in this case trolling.


Let him be, no need to keep it going.


Don't get me wrong, he's also in the wrong for running it down too and arguing with you just as much.


Conclusion: you're both at fault... should make that a 3rd option

The Support said something to him. To which he replied.

People need to understand that you don't always get to have the last word. Expecting it only shows how immature and self entitled you are.
This also shows an underlining issue with the mentality of players.

Just because you're arguing doesn't mean you're toxic.
Talking back to someone without crossing a line (like insults or rage) should never be deemed as toxic or be at fault (like in this case), even if it starts an argument. You can't control other people's emotion and you shouldn't have THEM control what you can do and say. If they overreact and take it the wrong way, then it's their problem, not yours.

It's actually a very acceptable idea for someone to reply "then back" when being told to stop pinging. It can actually be seen as advice if it were to happen again. But people like to play the victims, oh well.
Sorry, I don't agree with you saying it's both their fault. The Support is just a kid and should be banned. 
Funnily enough I bet he probably gets other players banned by making them rage at him for trolling/inting and provoking them like in this case.

actually he(adc) said something first as in "..." which in retrospect translate to "really?"

i understand you want to defend him, they're both children because they started arguing back and forth for a little before the support decided to int.

I don't care if you don't agree but when it comes to it, they both are in the wrong.

oh dear, he said "...", SO BAD, HOW COULD HE?

This isn't unicorn land though, with fairies and rainbows, people have to realise this. You just can't afford to be so soft skinned.

He made a salty comment, whatever, it could have easily been ignored and left it at that. But the victim-playing Support had to find an excuse to INT and troll.

His comment might spark the argument but he's not the one actually arguing. The Support player did everything himself and took it too far, escalating the argument.
EDIT: So if someone provokes you into doing something, do you then blame him for provoking you and making you do it?

lmao. league of legends is at fault, that person has probably had so many toxic adc's that have done that type of stuff before, on top of the fact that you have to play a 40 minute game that you may or may not lose, and then there's the stress of losing lp and having to waste even mooore time just to get back to where you were.

this support was obviously tilted and at fault, but can you really blame the support raised in this league community! xD and yeah I would take constant pinging as tilting/trying to provoke me

but thats the game.. people spam ping when trying to annoy others. never point out another person's mistakes, trust they won't take your advice, and even if after game they decide to take your advice....... you'll never see them again. the support inting is... well more acceptable than him flaming you why? because riot won't punish it lmao. unless they went 0/13

it wasn't really an argument. I only said one thing lol and he ran it down mid without replying. I shouldn't have said "then back" I guess. at the moment just seemed like a logical thing. Didn't know it would result in him just running it down mid
Yea, it happens and is unfortunate... it's prob more of, he knew he messed up and didn't need his teammate tossing it in his face like that and got more angry with it.
yeah, I guess, in the end, chat he said "no toxicity will be tolerated," the irony.

You obviously did nothing wrong ( if actually all you said was "then back" ) when he reacts by inting the game and ruining the experience for the rest of the teammates who werent even involved in the first place just shows how immature and toxic this guy was. Regardless of whether you or him made a mistake, even if you said something bad or insulting to him which I assume you did not, inting the game is as bad as toxicity gets and is never excuseable. The only mistake I can see is you asking the enemy team for reports, they often don't care and will see this as whining/verbal and just report you instead, not like you have to worry about it if you didn't do anything offensive but it can still make people on both teams distracted and angry
